result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges due 1 YEAR from today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: to Count 2 and any other sentence. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
Concurrent with: to Count 1 and any other sentence. 80 DAYS credit for time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Howard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Received, signed and filed:
Order denying request for payment plan and entering a civil judgment.
Copy forwarded to the defendant.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Letter from defendant requesting payment plan.

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 165 DAYS in the House of Correction, 165 DAYS credit for time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSTION, concurrent to Count 2 and any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, 80 DAYS credit for time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSTION, concurrent to Count 1 and any other sentence.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges due 1 YEAR from today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Lawrence Howard not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced for the 1st call of this case. Branch 23 is in trial, unable to spin this matter as this is a Sentencing after Jury Trial before branch 23. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 656
cf

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Lawrence Howard in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court placed off the record discussion on the record regarding Jury Question. Received & Filed, Question. Court previously provided answer to the Jury. Jury in the box. At the hour of 2:23 PM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict which was then read.
AS TO COUNT 1: GUILTY
AS TO COUNT 2: GUILTY
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned for Sentencing in branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Lawrence Howard in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in the box. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Rachel E.  Jury out of the box.  Court in recess.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Tony Saffold.  State rests.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court held colloquy with defendant regarding right to testify or remain silent.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVES his right to testify.  Defendant will not testify.  Discussion regarding Jury Instructions.  Jury in the box.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.   Alternate juror selected by lot.  Court held side bar in chambers. Jury out of the box. Discussion placed on the record regarding alternate juror. Court ordered alternate juror released. Jury in the box. Jury retired at the hour of 11:33 AM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Browne & Freuck who were duly sworn for that purpose. Discussion regarding scheduling. Received & Filed, Exhibit List. Court in recess pending  verdict.

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court, in custody, with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued. Panel out of the courtroom. Discussion regarding strikes for Cause.  Jury panel returned. Voir dire continued. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of the box. Remaining panel members ordered to return to Jury Management. Court in recess. Jury in the box and sworn. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Sgt. Delmar Williams. Exhibits #1-8 received, and published to the Jury. Jury instructed and released for the day. Jury ordered to return to at 8:45 AM on 5/7/2015 to branch 23. Jury out of the box. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Discussion regarding scheduling. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Lawrence Howard in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Parties ready to proceed to Jury Trial. Pretrial issues discussed. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:05 AM. Court instructed panel and released the panel for lunch. Panel ordered to return to Jury management at 1:25 PM. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Continued Jury Selection.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Lawrence Howard not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call. Parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial,all conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 05/06/2015.
Received and Filed, Letter from victim.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No In Person Contact order.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Lawrence Howard not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS before the Final Pretrial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: RACHEL E.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lawrence Howard in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Lawrence Howard in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
